org.gearvrf.io.cursor3d

Class SelectableBehavior

  • java.lang.Object
    • GVRBehavior
      • org.gearvrf.io.cursor3d.SelectableBehavior
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MovableBehavior

    public class SelectableBehavior
extends GVRBehavior
    This class defines a GVRBehavior that can be attached to a GVRSceneObject, it handles all the CursorEvents on the associated GVRSceneObject and maintains the correct SelectableBehavior.ObjectState based on the CursorEvents received. This class can associate a child GVRSceneObject with each SelectableBehavior.ObjectState and is responsible for making the correct GVRSceneObject visible according to the SelectableBehavior.ObjectState.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  SelectableBehavior.ObjectState
      Define all possible states the SelectableBehavior can be in
      static interface  SelectableBehavior.StateChangedListener
      Set a SelectableBehavior.StateChangedListener using setStateChangedListener(StateChangedListener) to get updates about the change of the state of the SelectableBehavior

    • Constructor Detail

      • SelectableBehavior

        public SelectableBehavior(CursorManager cursorManager)
        Creates a SelectableBehavior to be attached to any GVRSceneObject. The instance thus created will not change the appearance of the linked GVRSceneObject according to the SelectableBehavior.ObjectState.
        Parameters:
        cursorManager -

      • SelectableBehavior

        public SelectableBehavior(CursorManager cursorManager,
                          boolean initializeAllStates)
        Creates a SelectableBehavior which is to be attached to a GVRSceneObject with a specific hierarchy where, the attached GVRSceneObject has a separate child GVRSceneObject for each SelectableBehavior.ObjectState. The order of the child nodes has to follow SelectableBehavior.ObjectState.DEFAULT, SelectableBehavior.ObjectState.BEHIND, SelectableBehavior.ObjectState.COLLIDING, and SelectableBehavior.ObjectState.CLICKED from left to right where SelectableBehavior.ObjectState.DEFAULT corresponds to the first/left most child. The SelectableBehavior handles all the CursorEvents on the linked GVRSceneObject and maintains the SelectableBehavior.ObjectState. It also makes the correct child GVRSceneObject visible according to the SelectableBehavior.ObjectState. It is recommended that the different nodes representing different SelectableBehavior.ObjectState share a common set of vertices if possible. Not having the needed hierarchy will result in an IllegalArgumentException when calling GVRSceneObject#attachComponent(GVRComponent)
        Parameters:
        cursorManager - the CursorManager instance
        initializeAllStates - flag to indicate whether to initialize all possible SelectableBehavior.ObjectStates. true initialize all states in order from left to right:SelectableBehavior.ObjectState.DEFAULT, SelectableBehavior.ObjectState.BEHIND, SelectableBehavior.ObjectState.COLLIDING, and SelectableBehavior.ObjectState.CLICKED. false initializes only the SelectableBehavior.ObjectState.DEFAULT state. Which does not require the attached GVRSceneObject to have a hierarchy.

      • SelectableBehavior

        public SelectableBehavior(CursorManager cursorManager,
                          SelectableBehavior.ObjectState[] objectStates)
        Creates a SelectableBehavior which is to be attached to a GVRSceneObject with a specific hierarchy where, the GVRSceneObject to be attached has a root node at the top and a child for each of the states of the SelectableBehavior. The SelectableBehavior handles all the CursorEvents on the linked GVRSceneObject and maintains the SelectableBehavior.ObjectState. It also makes the correct child GVRSceneObject visible according to the SelectableBehavior.ObjectState. It is recommended to have a child for each SelectableBehavior.ObjectState value, however it is possible to have lesser children as long as the mapping is correctly specified in . If the does not match the GVRSceneObject hierarchy it will result in an IllegalArgumentException when calling GVRSceneObject#attachComponent(GVRComponent). To save on memory it is suggested that the children of the GVRSceneObject representing different SelectableBehavior.ObjectStates share a common set of vertices if possible.
        Parameters:
        cursorManager - the CursorManager instance
        objectStates - array of SelectableBehavior.ObjectStates that maps each child of the attached GVRSceneObject with an SelectableBehavior.ObjectState. Where the first element of the array maps to the left most/first child of the attached GVRSceneObject. This array should contain SelectableBehavior.ObjectState.DEFAULT as one of its elements else it will result in an IllegalArgumentException.

      • getState

        public SelectableBehavior.ObjectState getState()
        Gets the current SelectableBehavior.ObjectState of the SelectableBehavior
        Returns:
        the SelectableBehavior.ObjectState associated with this SelectableBehavior

      • setStateChangedListener

        public void setStateChangedListener(SelectableBehavior.StateChangedListener listener)
        Set the SelectableBehavior.StateChangedListener to be associated with the SelectableBehavior. The StateChangedListener#onStateChanged(SelectableBehavior, ObjectState, ObjectState, Cursor) is called every time the state of the SelectableBehavior is changed.
        Parameters:
        listener - the SelectableBehavior.StateChangedListener

      • getComponentType

        public static long getComponentType()
        Returns a unique long value Associated with the SelectableBehavior class. Each subclass of GVRBehavior needs a unique component type value. Use this value to get the instance of SelectableBehavior attached to any GVRSceneObject using GVRSceneObject#getComponent(long)
        Returns:
        the component type value.
